content: in a divorce case that took place in viru county court a final resolution was issued on 06112023 the court ruled that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the specific amount was not mentioned the case lasted for five months the parties involved in the case have reached a settlement regarding the division of their joint property they have requested a reduction in the deadline to lodge an appeal which is now 3 days the claimant will be refunded the fee they initially paid the divorce has been settled through a separate partial decision if either party wishes to appeal this decision they must do so within 3 days the claimant filed the divorce action on 04042023 and made corrections on 03052023 they are seeking to divide the joint property and have the defendant take responsibility for loan payments the parties submitted a signed agreement to divide their joint property and requested the court to close the proceedings the court can terminate the proceedings if the parties reach a compromise and the court confirms it the court approves the compromise agreement and ends the case the costs of the proceedings are shared by the parties and they have requested reimbursement for half of the fees which the court has granted the court finds that the compromise reached in this case is in the best interests of the parties and settles the divorce claim
